context: The Finnish word 'tämä' is a demonstrative pronoun that means 'this' when referring to something singular and nearby. It can also function as an adjective modifying nouns. The word has different forms depending on the case it's used in: tämä (nominative), tätä (partitive), tämän (genitive), etc. It's one of the most basic and frequently used words in Finnish for pointing out or identifying specific things or people.
